Z-scored for multilevel analyses It will group mean center and z-scored the L1 score and create a mean score for each L2 group.

z_scored_mlm_categorical.Rd

Z-scored for multilevel analyses It will group mean center and z-scored the L1 score and create a mean score for each L2 group.

z_scored_mlm_categorical(
  data,
  effect_coded,
  dummy_coded,
  group,
  keep_original = TRUE
)

Arguments

data

dataframe

effect_coded

effect coded variables for L1 group-mean centering

dummy_coded

dummy-coded variables for L2 aggregated means

group

the grouping variable. Must be character

keep_original

default is `FALSE`. Set to `TRUE` to keep original columns

Value

return a dataframe with the columns z-scored (replace existing columns)

Examples

iris %>% dplyr::mutate(cluster = rep(c(1,2,3),nrow(.)/3)) %>% effect_coding('Species',factor = FALSE) %>% dummy_coding('Species') %>% z_scored_mlm_categorical(effect_coded = dplyr::ends_with('eff'),dummy_coded = dplyr::ends_with('dum'),group = 'cluster')
#> Joining with `by = join_by(Species)`
#> Joining with `by = join_by(Species)`
#> # A tibble: 150 × 14
#>    Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species cluster
